Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI
public class GUI extends javafx.application.Application implements UI
Class GUI represents the main class for the Client Graphic Interface component. It initializes and updates the scene as well as handling messages coming from ClientSocket

  • Method Details

    • handleMessageFromServer

      public void handleMessageFromServer(Message message)
      Method handleMessageFromServer receives a Message instance from ClientSocket and react accordingly to the message type.
      Specified by:
      handleMessageFromServer in interface UI
      Parameters:
      message - received from server. If the message is instance of ClientStateMessage, handleMessageFromServer changes the current client state and if the current scene is updatable, it gets updated If the message is instance of ErrorMessage, handleMessageFromServer calls the current scene's controller error handling method If the message is instance of UpdateMessage, handleMessageFromServer updates the GameBoard instance and updates the scene if it's in WAIT_TURN state Since this method is called from another thread, Platform.runLater() ensures that the method is executed by this (GUI) thread to avoid run time exceptions

    • prepareView

      public void prepareView(ArrayList<Object> data)
      Method prepareView initializes the GameBoard with the game parameters (isExpert and numberOfPlayers)
      Specified by:
      prepareView in interface UI
      Parameters:
      data - received from MatchMaking controller when the player has sent game parameters

    • renderScene

      private void renderScene()
      Method renderScene sets the scene accordingly to the currentState and eventually renders the wait gray screen overlay In WAIT_TURN state it also does some additional operations to assure that the next scene is loaded in the correct moment

    • setupScenes

      public void setupScenes() throws IOException
      Method setupScenes initializes all the scenes and controllers, saving them in FXML Path-Scene and Scene-Controller hashmaps
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setScene

      public void setScene(String path)
      Method setScene changes the current scene accordingly to the fxml path received as parameter
      Parameters:
      path - represents the FXML path of the scene to load

    • setSceneShouldWait

      private void setSceneShouldWait(boolean value)
      Method setSceneShouldWait calls the current scene's controller waitTurn setter, so that the update() method inside controller "knows" if the wait overlay should be rendered or not.
      Parameters:
      value - is true if the wait overlay should be added, false if it should be removed

    • disableScene

      public void disableScene()
      Method disableScene adds to the stage the gray overlay.

    • enableScene

      public void enableScene()
      Method enableScene removes from the stage the gray overlay.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws IOException
      Method start sets the stage reference,sets the resolution, adds the icon to the window, sets up all the scenes and the game font and finally renders the main menu
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - is the GUI instance stage
      Throws:
      IOException

    • connect

      public void connect(String ip, String portText) throws IOException
      Method connect attempt a connection to the server by initializing a socket on a new thread and setting up the Nickname Menu scene
      Parameters:
      ip - represents the server ip
      portText - represent the port the server is listening on converted to String type
      Throws:
      IOException

      public void openConnectMenu()

      public void passToSocket(Message message)
      Method passToSocket sends a Message instance to the clientSocket instance so that it can be sent to the server
      Parameters:
      message - represents the message to send

    • handleClosingServer

      public void handleClosingServer()
      Method handleClosingServer removes the WAIT_TURN gray overlay and calls the end game procedures of the current scene's controller Since this method is called from another thread, Platform.runLater() ensures that the method is executed by this (GUI) thread to avoid run time exceptions
      Specified by:
      handleClosingServer in interface UI
